column4: I cannot access a web space. It needs FTPES and after logging in, it hangs at LIST. I read some pages on the web but couldn't make out, what I need to do to my  iptables  firewall, to let my FileZilla through. Can anyone help? Perhaps some suggestions, what I should be googeling for
set filezilla to active and see if it hangs as well
there are 2 types of ftp, active and passive, one uses only port 21 the other uses ports 20 and 21
already tried, still hangs. I believe, i need to configure my conntrack module of my linux router.
depending on the type then yes you do need connection tracking
i believe passive should work without connection tracking and only using port  21
i tried any possible combination of settings already

perhaps i am too stupid or the server isn't allowing the passive mode? the guy owing the web space is never available and some super linux geek. He probably assumes, I am as allmighty as he seems to be.
well it seems like your probably on the right track with looking into ftp connection tracking
well... there I am stuck now... i have been googleing for quite a while, i always find stuff how to make a server available
what disto is your router running?
only chance might be to connect my modem directly to my ubuntu box
im looking to verify but i think that the conntrack module you want is included in the netfilter tarball
it seems nf_conntrack can NOT handle ftpes, due to encryption. Gotta try something different now (assinging ports per hand)
looks like one solution may be to set up a proxy server on your router
